intro: Senecio hieracium, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind. Senecio hieracium is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
